intro: Mallotus barbatus var. congestus, commonly known as the clustered mallotus, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
